talk.author: did:plc:2su52uejyvgporcckxya5qla
talk.utter: No-no, it was not punctuation. It just took time to understand what is the Bad Place and who is Elmo. I started thinking about Sesame Street and was like "wtf he talk about", and then it clicked.

talk.author: did:plc:2su52uejyvgporcckxya5qla
talk.utter: Man, you don't need a bot to scrape data off this (or, in fact, any other) website. I'm 99.9% confident someone already fed this post and your post to the AI as soon as we wrote them here. Multiple times.

talk.author: did:plc:epbfrtd2maomq3bs3xum7t4l
talk.utter: This is true. There is an API for accessing the firehose of posts. I think BlueSky needs to look at whether that API needs to be freely available.

talk.author: did:plc:2su52uejyvgporcckxya5qla
talk.utter: Firehose is a crucial aspect of this websites architecture. If they start to restrict access, most of your feeds would just stop working. Besides, nothing stops the ai scrapper to have their own relay with their own firehose.

talk.author: did:plc:2su52uejyvgporcckxya5qla
talk.utter: Firehose is a crucial aspect of this websites architecture. If they start to restrict access, most of your feeds would just stop working. Besides, nothing stops the ai scrapper to have their own relay with their own firehose.

talk.author: did:plc:epbfrtd2maomq3bs3xum7t4l
talk.utter: I know, but API access could require a token etc. I think it's worthwhile to think about whether structure or policy changes could help address the issue instead of just hand wringing and expecting bad actors to abide by the rules.

talk.author: did:plc:2su52uejyvgporcckxya5qla
talk.utter: Again, as I told before. This is a decentralized network. The data hosts on 900 individual servers. If they block access to their own firehose, the scrappers can just make their own. In fact even you can do it, it will cost you around $300/month. For ai people it's almost free of charge.

talk.author: did:plc:2su52uejyvgporcckxya5qla

talk.author: did:plc:prln2gklqkgkynf5f3tnxtw2
talk.utter:
So the solution would be to make it not worth it for the scraper. Ie more expensive, more roadblocks they have to find work arounds with, not to mention any poisonin the data will be laced with to mess with the any ai learnin all around. 
Honestly im up for introducin a toxic inkwell for protection.

talk.author: did:plc:2su52uejyvgporcckxya5qla
talk.utter:
The expense part comes solely from the network size. To make it more expensive, you should just post more. Any roadblocks to scrappers would also serve as a roadblock to, you know, the ability of the network to function as intended.
As for poisoning, I mean, it's up to individual users who post here
